name: Mandarin Oriental, Atlanta

reviews.text: The Mandarin Oriental Atlanta is a deservedly 5 star hotel located in the Buckhead section of Atlanta close to restaurants and shopping and a short 20-30 min drive from the airport. The hotel driveway and courtyard are shared with a Del Frisco's Steakhouse and can get crowded in the evenings. Subtle elegance is the theme from the lobby and lounge decor to the exceptionally trained staff who are helpful and gracious.
reviews.title: Quietly elegant hotel in a great area

reviews.text: The room was spacious with very well thought out lighting, large windows and space to work and relax. Finishes were all excellent and very well maintained. The bed and linens were comfortable as well. There was an outlet near the bed, but not one on the desk itself to facilitate plugging in a laptop or cell phone. Hallway noise was not discernible from the bed, but could be mildly heard at the desk.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.text: The bath was spacious and well laid out with a soaking tub that had a TV mounted over it as well as a comfortably shower with nice fixtures.
reviews.title: Comfy hotel

reviews.text: Room service was prompt and while expensive the prices were in range with room service at most quality hotels. Staff person delivering the food polite and prompt as well.
reviews.title: Late Again!

reviews.text: If you are visiting Atlanta and looking for elegant accommodations, the Mandarin Oriental will clearly fit the bill.
reviews.title: A true getaway

reviews.text: This is a beautiful property, and the rooms are very nice. The service, particularly the front desk is understaffed (long waits at both check-in and check-out due to one person on duty), and the person on duty was overwhelmed because he also had to constantly answer phone calls. Also during my stay I called to concierge several times, but was transferred to the front desk due to the concierge being "unavailable", and again the front desk was less than pleased to take my call, and needless to say were unhelpful. In addition during my stay the television system was out for 5 hours from 8am to 1pm, no apologies or offer of compensation. I stay at the MO's in NYC, Wash, DC, and San Francisco VERY often for business and the level of service and attentiveness is far superior to this property. The Ritz Carlton Buckhead and the Four Seasons Buckhead are much better options when staying in Atlanta.
reviews.title: Service Not Up To Mandarin Oriental standards

reviews.text: Check in was easy. Lots of service there and getting to our rooms. I brought someone along who never experienced this property and she went nuts over her room and the amenities. We hated to leave but we will always stay here when in Atlanta.
reviews.title: Wonderful property lives up to the Mandarin Oriental standard

reviews.text: We have spent a couple of days at the Mandarin Oriental in Atlanta , GA just to find out that it is the best hotel we have been at!
reviews.title: The Best Hotel we have been at!!!

reviews.text: My husband , a part of our closest family and me spent a few days at this hotel and it is really an unbelievable place to spend and relax!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is wonderful and it is really a special feeling they gave us as their guests!
reviews.title: Annual visitors

reviews.text: I was about to type "Best Hotel in Atlanta" as my title when I saw it has been taken. Well, it's the perfect title so I'll just add an additional version. I've also stayed at Atlanta's "best" and the Mandarin Oriental takes the lead by a long mile. The service is unmatched by any hotel or restaurant in the city and rivals the best in other large cities. My friend and I were so accommodated by the woman who checked us in and helped us figure out a fantastic room upgrade that did not break the bank. Our server at the hotel's cafe where we had lunch was just excellent as were the valets and bellman.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Atlanta 2
Best Hotel in Atlanta
reviews.text: Our suite was breathtaking - over 1,000 square feet - with two balconies and gorgeous light fixtures and amenities. We were perplexed but the lack of places to hang a robe or a towel, but that was more humorous than annoying.

The spa is by far the best in the city. You would have to drive to Reynolds Plantation to find any better. I'm personally over sensitive to fragrances and the gorgeous purple orchids that were everywhere had me sneezing the rest of the day but note-to-self, I'll take a benedryl before I go next time because I would never miss their spa experience on a future stay.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Del Frisco's is across from the hotel entrance and a fun and swank place. We had a great experience and there are many other great options just a 5 minute walk from the Mandarin.
reviews.title: Service Beyond Reproach

reviews.text: I can't recommend this hotel more.
reviews.title: I'd give 6 stars if I could.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the MO from 10/18 through 10/21. We were on the 9th floor in a Mandarin Terrace Room which had a nice view of the Buckhead area. The room was very large, luxurious and had the largest TV (approx. 50") I have ever seen in a hotel room. The bathroom had a TV as well for viewing from the deep soaking tub. The bed and numerous pillows were terrific. I slept longer than I usually do at home. Maybe it was the blackout drapes. We ordered room service two evenings and the food came in half the time (15 mins.) as their verbal estimate. The food was very good as well.
reviews.title: The Best Rooms

reviews.text: We visited the pool and fitness area and it was very clean and luxurious with staff from the spa to assist if needed. We used the hotel complimentary car service to go the malls and restaurants in the local area. The driver, Bruce, was very efficient and helpful. The wait time was only a matter of minutes. The valet and doorman were very efficient and always greeted us when we returned to the hotel.
reviews.title: MO is GREAT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast the first morning in the hotel's restaurant, I believe it was called The Cafe. This was not up to the standards of what you would expect of MO, Ritz Carlton or a Four Seasons. The food was very good but the service was way too slow and it made for a bad experience in the restaurant. We did not eat in that restaurant again to see if our experience was a one time event. Lastly, we had a charge on our statement from the room stocked refrigerator which I never accessed. It was corrected at checkout, but it goes to show, you need to examine every charge on your statement.
reviews.title: Fantastic Birthday Weekend
Five Star Service without feeling stuffy....
reviews.text: I gave this hotel a rating of 4 stars instead of 5 because of the poor service in their restaurant. Otherwise, this is definitely a 5 star gem in a great location in Buckhead.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: This place is great. We just returned from a weekend event trip to Atlanta from Florida for two nights. Everyone we came into contact with from the valet, doorman, front desk, room service, etc., was extremely professional, friendly and polite. The rooms are top class, spacious, extremely well appointed and comfortable.

description: At Mandarin Oriental, Atlanta we offer you stylish relaxation, a step away from the fashionable boutiques of Buckhead. Our light airy interiors are finished with the refined luxury of a high-class Atlanta residence. Our restaurant has a superb reputation and our spa is a serene retreat for effective therapy.
